summary: The image appears to be a screenshot from a scientific paper or presentation slide, which contains a list of terms related to molecular biology and gene expression. The text mentions "IFN" (interferon), "cells," "expression," "plans," and "determine." It also discusses the use of azacytidine and methionine in cell cultures, and refers to "control," "time," "transferase," "permits," and "na." Additionally, there are references to "SCIENTIFIC," "PEER," and "MATERIAL." The overall content suggests that it is related to laboratory research or a similar academic context.
corrected_text: % 9/23/91 CC:DRS, FELDMAN, PIERCE, MCALISTER, car staff F ~ Grant Application No, 2384 B Amason, reviewer, Page 1 interferon and 2-5A Expression in Alzheimer s Disease Fibroblasts . Joseph M. Wa, Phd j @ NVESTIGATOR. Dr. Wu is 44. He did his undergraduate work at McGill, bis PhD in biological sciences at Florida State University, graduating in 1975 following which he did a postdoc in Biochemistry at Temple. He has been at New York Medical College since 1978 end a professor in the department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology since 1987. He reports 72 published papers and lists 9 publications relevant ta the proposed work, Also included is a C.V. for Shao-jlan An, 2 research associate from China who has been with Dr. Wu for the past 2 years, He had worked on 2-5A synthetase while still at the Institute of Microbiology in Beijing and has continued this work at my Medical College. BUDGET. This is a renewal application. Current funding is $80,000 per year and the same amount is requested for the continuation, Dr, Wu will devote 15% effort to this project and requests 15,441 towards his salary, shavian An is listed for 100% effort and 50% salary recovery is requested for a technician who will maintain the cultured cells and perform routine biochemical procedures, $12,500 is requested for supplies which would appear to be an underestimate of needs, and $4000 for other expenses. PROPOSAL. In the prior granting period the P.L. has explored differences between control and familial Alzheimer's disease (AD) fibroblasts with regard to premature senescence and has made the intriguing observation that Type 1 interferon (IFN)-induced 2-5A synthetase activity is aberrant in familial AD, The enzyme exists in 2 lower my forms of 40 and 46 ED derived from the same gene by alternative splicing and a 100 kid form probably derived from 4 different gene. The enzyme acting through 2-5A converts later raise L to its e active form which then degrades viral and cellular RNA, 2-5A synthetase is believed to be of critical importance in body defense against picornaviruses. In 5 familial AD case fibroblast lines in fails to Induce the 40 kid 2-5A synthetase and the mana is not made suggesting either an aberrancy in synthetase gene promoter or other 5 exon sequences in familial AD. He has evidence that the 2-54 synthetase gene is hypomethylated in AD cells suggesting an altered na structure for certain genes in AD because of an altered methylation state which predisposes to changed genetic transcription and/or processing, The problem does not reside at the level of in binding which has been shown to be normal for @. 8, and y-IEN in AD cells, Synthetase in AD cells has an acidic pH optimal whereas in control cells activity is maximal at alkaline pH. Presumably this reflects preferential expression of the 46 kid form in AD, the absence of the 40 kid form and a reduced expression of the 100 kid form. Surprisingly, at least 10 this reviewer, raise L activity is reported as increased in AD celis, Based on studies taking advantage of hyperthermia which regulates synthetase mana levels by stabilizing mana and of phobos esters which augment IFN-induced synthetase induction of synthetase the Pl. has satisfied. himself chat a post-transcriptional mechanism is not implicated in the altered expression of synthetase mana in AD, Rather he favors differential processing at the 2 end of the primary transcript which depends on availability of a proximal or distal polyadenyletion site, An alternative would be a different promoter. Based on these date the Pl. hypothesizes that AD is characterized by an altered na methylation state and plans to test the effects of methylation modulators such as S-azacytidine and methionine on control and AD cells to determine whether control cells can be made to mimic the AD state. He also e@ proposes to characterize proteins that bind to na containing C,Gs in control and AD cells in the presence or absence of IFN, Finally he will measure na methyl transferase time permits, era AVOTONNAN-GOVETHD A * WEOFIZT 16 we to CTR-CONFIDENTIAL SUBJECT TO P.O. minus v.
